name: BlazeMeter Integration
description: Allows you to run blazemeter tests in azure pipelines.
author: BlazeRunner

inputs.name: testurl
inputs.label: Test URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Login to BlazeMeter account. Click on Tests from top nav bar. Select name of your test. Copy the URL of test page.

inputs.name: selectUploadfile
inputs.label: Do You Want To Update The Files Before The Test Execution?

options.uploadfile: Yes, I Want To Update Main Test File And Its Dependencies
options.uploadjson: Yes, I want To Update Several Test Files Using JSON

options.uploadfile: Upload Main Test File And Its Dependencies
options.uploadjson: Upload Several Test Files Using JSON

inputs.name: UploadJsonFile
inputs.label: Upload Json File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Input json file path for Update Main Test File Or Upload Dependencies

inputs.name: updateMainTestFile
inputs.label: Update Main Test File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to upload main test file for existing test

inputs.name: inputstartfile
inputs.label: Upload Test Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Upload test script like JMX, selenium etc.

inputs.name: Uploadfilechk
inputs.label: Upload Dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this to upload tests dependant script.

inputs.name: projectID
inputs.label: Project ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the project ID. If you don't specify project ID, test will get created in the default project.

inputs.name: MultitestFile
inputs.label: Multitest File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Input json file path for multitest

inputs.name: totalusers
inputs.label: Total Users
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the number of users you want to deploy at the peak of your test.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: Duration (min)
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can configure your test to run for a specified duration.

inputs.name: rampup
inputs.label: Ramp up Time (min)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select how fast you want the test to ramp-up.  This is the elapsed time in minutes from test start until all users are running.

inputs.name: showtaillog
inputs.label: Show Log
inputs.helpMarkDown: When this flag is checked, log file will be displayed in the console.

inputs.name: buildStatus
inputs.label: Ignore SLA
inputs.helpMarkDown: When this flag is checked, regardless of the SLA, build will succeed
